snippet: Efforts to combat the widespread use of drugs in horse racing have been fragmented and ineffectual. Perhaps it’s time to bring in the United States Antidoping Agency.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column observes that doping continues to cast a dark shadow over horse racing despite fragmented efforts to combat widespread drug use; contends that it may be time for sport to bring in the United States Antidoping Agency.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to combat the widespread use of drugs in horse racing have been fragmented and ineffectual. Perhaps it’s time to bring in the United States Antidoping Agency.

headline.main: Horse Racing Still Stumbling in Antidrug Push
headline.print_headline: Horse Racing Still Stumbling in Antidrug Push
